200BC.notes: Latin is the primary language of the Roman Republic.
Iberian languages dominate, with some influence from Celtic and Greek colonies.
Celtic languages are widely spoken across Gaul (modern France).

1AD.notes: Latin has spread to much of Western Europe as the Roman Empire reaches its peak.
Germanic tribes dominate the areas beyond the Roman borders.
Celtic languages remain dominant in Britain, with limited Roman influence in the south.

500AD.notes: Latin is still spoken, but Germanic languages have become dominant due to migrations and the fall of Rome.
Anglo-Saxon invasions introduce Old English alongside Celtic languages.
Latin remains the main language but is evolving into early forms of Italian.
